intro: Panopsis polystachya, commonly known as the white-flowered panicled grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, white or pale blue florets that bloom in panicles. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, this plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and full sun. Its rapid growth and dense foliage make it a common ornamental and erosion control plant in landscaping. The plant's botanical structure includes long, parallel-veined leaves and a fibrous root system that aids in soil stabilization.
